channel.title: 2 questions please answer
channel.description:
Excuse me for being noobish (my server's been up only 1 day) and I think I've progressed and learnt quite a bit so far from the tutorials posted on this site..
1. What file do I need to edit to change shop-prices? 2. [REQ] This is totally my idea, but is it possible for someone to create a code that on server start spawns a wall to close the entry to the palace (2 places both consisting of 2x1) 1st place: 3224,3465 | 3224,3466 2nd place: 3213,3458 | 3212,3458
And then when an admin types ::open the walls dissapear and ::close they close again?
If not possible then maybe a teleport command into the castle (I can do this myself im pretty sure) My main concern is how to spawn objects the tutorials aren't very clear.. If I knew how to spawn objects/remove them I'd code it myself. EDIT: Running on testscape source.

item.title: 2 questions please answer
item.dc:creator: @danieb danieb
item.description:
@danieb wrote:

first question:
edit the first 2 values of the items in items.cfg buy/sell

second question:
the tuts are very clear if you know what your doing

Read full topic

item.title: 2 questions please answer
item.dc:creator: @Warchild Warchild
item.description:
@Warchild wrote:

Excuse me for being noobish (my server’s been up only 1 day) and I think I’ve progressed and learnt quite a bit so far from the tutorials posted on this site…

  1. What file do I need to edit to change shop-prices?
  2. [REQ] This is totally my idea, but is it possible for someone to create a code that on server start spawns a wall to close the entry to the palace (2 places both consisting of 2x1)
    1st place: 3224,3465 | 3224,3466
    2nd place: 3213,3458 | 3212,3458

And then when an admin types ::open the walls dissapear and ::close they close again?

If not possible then maybe a teleport command into the castle (I can do this myself im pretty sure)
My main concern is how to spawn objects the tutorials aren’t very clear… If I knew how to spawn objects/remove them I’d code it myself.
EDIT: Running on testscape source.

Read full topic
